test_cases.issue_description: Customer unable to access support transcript dataset
test_cases.test_scenario: Verify customer support transcript dataset accessibility
preconditions: Customer has access to support transcript dataset
test_steps: Step 1: Log in to TASORA channel
Step 2: Attempt to access support transcript dataset
Step 3: Verify dataset is accessible and records are available
test_cases.expected_result: Customer is able to access support transcript dataset with all records
test_cases.actual_issue: Customer unable to access support transcript dataset
test_cases.customer_impact: Customer unable to access necessary support resources

test_cases.issue_description: Customer unable to change plan immediately online due to system limitation
test_cases.test_scenario: Test plan change functionality on web portal to ensure immediate upgrade option is available
preconditions: Customer has used a significant amount of data in the current cycle
Customer is logged in to their account on the web portal
test_steps: Step 1: Log in to customer account on web portal
Step 2: Attempt to change plan to a higher data plan
Step 3: Verify if immediate upgrade option is available
Step 4: Verify if prorated charge is calculated correctly
test_cases.expected_result: Customer is able to change plan immediately with a prorated charge
test_cases.actual_issue: System limitation prevents immediate plan change online, forcing customers to wait until next billing cycle
edge_cases: Test with different plan types and data usage scenarios
Test with multiple failed attempts to change plan
test_cases.customer_impact: Customer frustration and unnecessary support calls

test_cases.issue_description: Port request stuck due to missing middle initial in customer's name
test_cases.test_scenario: Test port request with customer name having middle initial
preconditions: Customer has a Verizon account with middle initial in their name
Customer has purchased a new phone from Total Wireless website
test_steps: Step 1: Enter customer's Verizon account info with only first and last name on the activation page
Step 2: Submit the port request
Step 3: Verify the port request status
test_cases.expected_result: Port request should be successful and not stuck
test_cases.actual_issue: Port request gets stuck due to missing middle initial in customer's name
edge_cases: Test with different types of middle initials (e.g. Jr., Sr., III)
Test with different character lengths for middle initial

test_cases.issue_description: Customer is charged for international roaming without notification when near the border
test_cases.test_scenario: Test automatic border roaming without customer notification
preconditions: User has a phone with international roaming capabilities
User is near the Mexican border in the US
test_steps: Step 1: User travels to an area near the Mexican border in the US
Step 2: User's phone automatically connects to a Mexican tower
Step 3: Verify that the user's phone does not display any roaming notifications or warnings
Step 4: Verify that the user is charged for international roaming
test_cases.expected_result: The user's phone should display a roaming notification or warning when automatically connecting to a foreign tower, and the user should not be charged for international roaming without their knowledge
test_cases.actual_issue: Customer is charged for international roaming without notification when near the border
test_cases.customer_impact: Unexpected charges and poor customer experience

test_cases.issue_description: Pricing discrepancy between product page and checkout page
test_cases.test_scenario: Verify that pricing on product page accurately reflects conditional promotions
preconditions: User is logged in to their account
User has an existing line to upgrade
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to product page of Samsung Galaxy A54
Step 2: Verify price displayed on product page
Step 3: Proceed to checkout
Step 4: Verify price displayed on checkout page
test_cases.expected_result: Pricing on product page and checkout page should match, with clear indication of any conditional promotions
test_cases.actual_issue: Pricing on product page and checkout page do not match, with unclear conditional promotions
test_cases.customer_impact: Prevents customer time wasted and trust issues due to misleading pricing

test_cases.issue_description: Plan change buttons do not respond on website for accounts with multiple add-ons
test_cases.test_scenario: Test plan change feature on website for accounts with multiple add-ons
preconditions: Account with multiple add-ons (e.g. international calling and mobile hotspot)
test_steps: Step 1: Log in to customer portal on laptop using Chrome browser
Step 2: Navigate to plan management page
Step 3: Click on plan change button
Step 4: Verify plan change options are displayed
test_cases.expected_result: Plan change options are displayed and functional
test_cases.actual_issue: Plan change buttons do not respond, no error message is displayed
test_cases.customer_impact: Silent failures, unable to change plan online

test_cases.issue_description: Existing customers unable to apply promotional code sent via email, receiving 'code not valid' error
test_cases.test_scenario: Verify promotional code validity for existing customers
preconditions: Existing customer account with associated email address
Promotional code sent via email with no clear eligibility criteria
test_steps: Step 1: Log in to customer portal with existing customer credentials
Step 2: Attempt to apply promotional code received via email
Step 3: Verify error message received is 'code not valid'
test_cases.expected_result: Promotional code should be successfully applied to existing customer's account
test_cases.actual_issue: Promotional code not valid for existing customers despite receiving email offer
edge_cases: Test with different types of promotional codes
Test with multiple attempts to apply code
test_cases.customer_impact: Customer frustration and potential loss of sale

test_cases.issue_description: Data usage tracking discrepancy between mobile app and phone's built-in data tracker
test_cases.test_scenario: Verify data usage tracking accuracy in mobile app
preconditions: Setup test user with active data plan
Ensure test user has used data in the current billing cycle
test_steps: Step 1: Open mobile app and navigate to data usage tracking page
Step 2: Note down the data usage displayed in the app
Step 3: Check phone's built-in data tracker and note down the data usage
Step 4: Compare the data usage values from the app and phone's built-in tracker
Step 5: Verify that the data usage values are within an acceptable margin of error (e.g. 1GB)
test_cases.expected_result: Data usage values in the mobile app and phone's built-in tracker should match within an acceptable margin of error
test_cases.actual_issue: Data usage values in the mobile app and phone's built-in tracker do not match, resulting in customer uncertainty and potential overages
edge_cases: Test with different data plan types (e.g. unlimited, limited, prepaid)
Test with different phone models and OS versions
test_cases.customer_impact: Customer uncertainty about data usage, potential overages or throttling

test_cases.issue_description: SMS commands listed in HELP menu are not functional
test_cases.test_scenario: Verify that all SMS commands listed in HELP menu are functional and return correct responses
preconditions: Setup SMS service with a test account
Send HELP command to retrieve list of available commands
test_steps: Step 1: Send each command listed in HELP menu response
Step 2: Verify response for each command
Step 3: Check for 'invalid command' errors
test_cases.expected_result: All SMS commands listed in HELP menu return correct responses without 'invalid command' errors
test_cases.actual_issue: Some SMS commands listed in HELP menu return 'invalid command' errors
test_cases.customer_impact: Customer expectations not met, time wasted due to misleading HELP menu
